questions.question: When it is legal to drive off the road to pass another vehicle?

answers.text: If the vehicle ahead is turning left.
It is not legal under any conditions.
If there are two or more one-way lanes.

questions.question: When a railroad crossing is not controlled, what is the speed limit when you are within 100 feet and cannot see for 400 feet in both directions?

answers.text: 15 mph.
10 mph.
25 mph.

questions.question: Which of the following is the proper procedure for parallel parking?

answers.text: Drive forward into the space without stopping.
Stop next to the vehicle behind the open space, and then drive forward into the space.
Stop next to the vehicle in front of the open space, and then back into the space.

questions.question: What speed should you be driving when entering onto a highway?

answers.text: At or near the speed of traffic.
Faster than the speed of traffic.
Slower than the speed of traffic.

questions.question: How many feet away should you switch from high beam to low beam headlights when approaching a vehicle coming towards you?

answers.text: 900 feet.
700 feet.
500 feet.

questions.question: Who can legally park next to curb painted blue?

answers.text: Someone who is either picking up or dropping off passengers at this location.
A person who is disabled and has a special placard or vehicle license plate for disabled persons.
A person who will only be parked at the curb for less than 15 minutes.

questions.question: What should you do when there is a school bus ahead that starts flashing yellow warning lights?

answers.text: Slow down and prepare to stop.
Stop immediately and remain stopped.
Cautiously pass the school bus on the left.

questions.question: Which of the following is a requirement of California's Basic Speed Law?

answers.text: Always drive the speed limit, regardless of conditions.
Match your speed to that of your surrounding traffic.
Never drive faster than is safe for current conditions.

questions.question: You must notify the DMV within 5 days, if you:

answers.text: Paint your vehicle a different color.
Sell or transfer ownership of your vehicle.
Receive a traffic violation.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a safe driving practice?

answers.text: Staring only at the middle of the road.
Always keep your eyes moving to scan the surroundings.
Using your high-beam headlights in the fog.

questions.question: What should you do when reaching an intersection where a person operating a motorized wheelchair has entered the crosswalk?

answers.text: Remain stopped behind the crosswalk line until the motorized wheelchair has safely finished crossing.
Remain stopped behind the nearest crosswalk line until the motorized wheelchair is beyond the range of your vehicle.
Assume right-of-way if the motorized wheelchair stops in the crosswalk.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about large trucks?

answers.text: They are made of many trailers, which make them more maneuverable than passenger vehicles.
They have large blind spots, which makes it difficult for the truck driver to see other vehicles.
They have large and powerful emergency brakes, which gives them the capability to stop quickly.

questions.question: What is one of the most common causes of traffic collisions?

answers.text: Paying attention to your surroundings.
Better traffic flow.
Driver distractions.

questions.question: Any driver who willfully flees or attempts to evade law enforcement, during which a person is seriously injured, is subject to:

answers.text: Imprisonment in a state prison for up to seven years.
A fine of less than $1,000.
Attending an anger-management class.

questions.question: What should a driver do who is stopped at an intersection and wants to make a left turn?

answers.text: Turn immediately if there are no pedestrians.
Take the right-of-way turn before oncoming traffic.
Give the right-of-way to any approaching vehicle that is close enough to be dangerous.

questions.question: In addition to setting your parking brake, what should you do when parking on a hill?

answers.text: Make sure the front vehicle wheels are parallel to the road.
Make sure your vehicle is left in the “neutral” position.
Make sure your vehicle is in the “park” position or in gear.

questions.question: You are under 18 years of age and have had your license for eight months. You may drive:

answers.text: At any time.
Between 5 a.m. and 11 p.m.
Between 7 a.m. and 8 p.m.

questions.question: Where should you begin a left turn from a one-way street onto a one-way street?

answers.text: The lane closest to the center of the street.
The far-left lane.
You can turn from any lane.

questions.question: You are required to notify DMV by filing a Report of Traffic Accident Occurring in California (SR-1) form if:

answers.text: You allowed a licensed driver from another state to drive your vehicle.
You were involved in a collision with more than $1,000 in damages.
You failed to pay your registration fees.

questions.question: At what point during a rainfall are roads slippery on a hot day?

answers.text: Immediately after it has stopped raining.
For the first several minutes.
When it has been raining for a few hours.

questions.question: What color curb does not allow vehicles to stop or park?

answers.text: Yellow.
Red.
White.

questions.question: What is indicated by two sets of double yellow lines spaced 2 feet or more apart?

answers.text: Lanes of traffic moving in the same direction.
Barrier.
Carpool/High-Occupancy (HOV) lane.

questions.question: What should you do to make a right turn at an upcoming intersection?

answers.text: Merge into the bicycle lane before making the turn.
Wait until the bicycle lane ends, then make the turn.
Make the turn from your current lane and do not enter the bicycle lane.

questions.question: A highway has a posted speed limit of 65 mph. What does this mean?

answers.text: You must always drive 65 mph on that highway.
You may drive faster only if there are no other vehicles.
You must drive 65 mph only if driving conditions are ideal.

questions.question: When is parking in a crosshatched (diagonal lines) area allowed?

answers.text: It is never allowed to park in a crosshatched (diagonal lines) area.
If the area is at least twenty feet away from a railroad track.
If the area is labeled as a bicycle lane, unless otherwise posted.

questions.question: What should you do if your cell phone rings and you do not have a hands-free device?

answers.text: Answer the call and keep the conversation short.
Do not answer the phone and let it go to voice mail.
Answer the call if you are stopped at a red light.

questions.question: If a traffic signal is green, but traffic is blocking the intersection, what should you do?

answers.text: Partially enter the intersection, as allowed by traffic.
Wait and do not enter the intersection until your vehicle can get completely across.
Drive around the traffic on the shoulder to help ease the congestion.

questions.question: In which lane should you end your turn when making a right turn?

answers.text: Any lane free of traffic.
The lane closest to the left edge of the road.
The lane closest to the right edge of the road.

questions.question: When is it required for you to obey directions from a crossing guard?

answers.text: At all times.
During school hours only.
Only when children are present in front of a school.

questions.question: Which of the following is illegal while driving?

answers.text: Wearing a headset or ear plugs that covers both ears.
Wearing a headset or ear plugs that covers one ear.
Using cruise control on residential streets.

questions.question: What should you do when traffic is slow and heavy, and you must cross railroad tracks before reaching the upcoming intersection?

answers.text: Begin crossing when the vehicle in front of you is crossing the tracks.
Wait on the tracks until the stoplight at the intersection turns green.
Wait until you can completely cross the tracks before proceeding.

questions.question: Which of the following should you do if you are being followed by a tailgater?

answers.text: Change lanes and allow the tailgater to pass.
Tap the brakes to signal you are moving at a slower pace.
Increase your speed to match the speed of the vehicle.

questions.question: When you are driving the speed limit, you can be given a speeding ticket:

answers.text: If road or weather conditions require a slower speed.
Under no circumstances because it is always legal.
Only if you are approaching a sharp curve in the road.

questions.question: Which lights should be used if a driver is having trouble seeing other vehicles because of dust or smoke blowing across the roadway?

answers.text: Parking lights.
Emergency lights.
Headlights.

questions.question: What does a flashing yellow traffic signal light direct a driver to do?

answers.text: Stop and proceed when the traffic allows you to proceed safely.
Slow down and proceed with caution.
Stop and wait for a flashing green signal.

questions.question: What should you do if a pedestrian is still in the crosswalk after the 'DON'T WALK' sign begins to flash and your light has turned green?

answers.text: Wait until the pedestrian is out of your path before proceeding.
Wait until the pedestrian signals that it is okay for you to proceed.
Wait until the pedestrian has crossed the street completely before proceeding.

questions.question: When is it legal for a person to drive with an alcoholic beverage container that has been opened?

answers.text: If the container is under the front seat.
If the container is in the trunk of the vehicle.
If the container is in the glove compartment.

questions.question: If you are found guilty of driving without wearing a seat belt, you will be fined up to _____ if this was your first offense.
In California, when are you allowed to drive to the left of two solid yellow lines?

answers.text: When you are passing another vehicle.
Never.
When you are in a carpool/HOV lane with a designated entrance on the left.

questions.question: You should cut your speed in half when the road is:

answers.text: Icy.
Packed with snow.
Wet.

questions.question: In which of the following places is a U-turn permitted?

answers.text: Across a double yellow line.
On a one-way street.
On a railroad crossing.

questions.question: If a CA driver is convicted of fleeing a law enforcement officer on duty without causing any bodily injuries, he or she may face which of the following penalties?

answers.text: Up to one year in jail.
A fine of up to $1,000.
Both of the above.

questions.question: A _________ indicates the outer edge of a roadway, and it may be crossed only by traffic moving to or from the shoulder.

answers.text: Broken white line.
Solid white line.
Solid yellow line.

questions.question: Can you pass another vehicle when approaching a curve or a hill?

answers.text: Yes, but you may only pass on the right.
Yes, but only if there is enough space.
No, never.

questions.question: This warning sign means:

answers.text: The road ahead curves to the right and then to the left.
A winding road.
The road ahead curves to the right.
Sharp right and left turns are ahead.

questions.question: Which of these pavement markings separates two lanes traveling in the same direction?

answers.text: B
C
A
None of the above.

questions.question: You will be fined up to ___ if convicted of assaulting a highway worker.
You must not follow within _______ of any emergency vehicle with a siren or flashing lights.

answers.text: 300 feet.
100 feet.
200 feet.

questions.question: This sign is:

answers.text: A guide sign on an interstate highway.
A barricade at a work zone.
An object marker on a roadway.
A warning sign at a work zone.

questions.question: When you turn left from a one-way street onto another one-way street, you should turn into:

answers.text: The far right lane.
The far left lane.
Any safely open lane.

questions.question: If you are convicted of reckless driving that resulted in injury to someone, you may:

answers.text: Lose your license for life.
Attend an interview at the DMV.
Be sent to jail and/or pay a hefty fine.

questions.question: On one-way roads, yellow lines are used as:

answers.text: Center lines.
Left-edge lines.
Right-edge lines.

questions.question: A traffic signal with a flashing yellow arrow means that you should:

answers.text: Stop and be prepared to obey the next signal.
Proceed with caution but turns are not permitted in the direction of the arrow.
Yield and then proceed with caution.

questions.question: Any person who willfully flees or attempts to evade law enforcement performing their duties is guilty of a misdemeanor punishable by:

answers.text: Up to 1 year of imprisonment in a county jail.
A maximum fine of up to $1,000.
Neither of the above.

questions.question: At an unmarked crosswalk, you must:

answers.text: Yield the right-of-way to the pedestrians.
Increase your speed and cross before the pedestrians.
Stop and ask the pedestrians to cross quickly.

questions.question: If you are ready to turn right at an intersection, and if there is a bicycle next to you on your right, who has the right-of-way when the light turns green?

answers.text: You.
The bicycle.
Whoever starts moving first.

questions.question: This sign warns you about:

answers.text: A two-way road.
A slippery road.
A winding road.

questions.question: A driver in front of you is signaling with his or her hand and arm pointing upward. This driver wants to:

answers.text: Stop.
Turn left.
Turn right.

questions.question: The only cure for carbon monoxide poisoning is:

answers.text: A few glasses of water.
Cold application.
A good supply of fresh air.

questions.question: A ___ painted curb is designated for disabled persons who display their placards.

answers.text: Green.
White.
Blue.

questions.question: A double solid white line:

answers.text: Separates two lanes traveling in the same direction, and crossing the line is permitted.
Separates opposing lanes, and crossing the line is prohibited.
Separates two lanes traveling in the same direction, but crossing the line is prohibited.

questions.question: Which of the following signs represents two-way traffic?

answers.text: B
A
D
C

questions.question: What type of sign is this?

answers.text: Yield.
Stop.
Slow-moving vehicle.

questions.question: What does this warning sign mean?

answers.text: Slow-moving vehicles should not move as directed.
There is a stop sign ahead.
Slow-moving vehicles should move as directed.

questions.question: If you are in an intersection when you hear the siren of an emergency vehicle, you should:

answers.text: Move to the right and stop in the intersection.
Continue through the intersection, then move to the right and stop.
Continue through the intersection, then move to the left and stop.

questions.question: If you are having vehicle trouble and you need to stop, what is the first thing you should do?

answers.text: Stop your vehicle over a hill or just around a curve for visibility.
Lift the hood to signal an emergency.
Pull off the road and away from traffic.

questions.question: When two vehicles meet on a steep mountain road where neither can pass, which vehicle has the right-of-way?

answers.text: The vehicle traveling downhill.
The vehicle traveling uphill.
Both vehicles.

questions.question: To help manage sun glare you should:

answers.text: Make sure your car visor works and is free of anything that would restrict use.
Keep the inside and outside of your windshield clean; wear polarized sunglasses.
Do both of the above.

questions.question: A steady red arrow signal means:

answers.text: You should prepare to stop and yield to oncoming traffic before turning.
You must stop and then proceed when it is safe to do so.
You must stop and you cannot turn in the direction of the arrow.

questions.question: If all the rear seats are already occupied by children under 7 years of age, a child under 8 years of age may:

answers.text: Ride in the front seat if properly secured in a federally approved child passenger restraint system.
Ride in the front seat without a seat belt.
Sit on the lap of an elder child, with a seat belt fastened to both.

questions.question: To avoid tailgating, one should follow the:

answers.text: Four-second rule.
Two-second rule.
Three-second rule.

questions.question: When you approach an intersection with a through road but without stop signs or yield signs, you must:

answers.text: Make a sharp turn to match the speed of the traffic on the through road.
Yield to traffic and pedestrians on the through road.
Accelerate to merge with traffic.

questions.question: What does this sign mean?

answers.text: Airplanes fly in this direction.
You are approaching an airport.
Airplanes fly at low altitude in this area.

questions.question: While driving in fog, you should use your:

answers.text: High-beam headlights.
Emergency flashers.
Low-beam headlights.

questions.question: A(n) __________ sign on a truck means that the truck's load is potentially dangerous.

answers.text: Rectangular white.
Octagonal.
Diamond-shaped.

questions.question: In a roundabout, you must drive in:

answers.text: A counterclockwise direction.
The direction of the oncoming vehicles.
A clockwise direction.

questions.question: You must turn on your headlights __________ after sunset.

answers.text: 30 minutes.
Immediately.
20 minutes.

questions.question: Locked wheel skids are usually caused by:

answers.text: Pressing the gas and brake pedals at the same time.
Braking too hard at a high speed.
Turning the ignition to the lock position while the vehicle is still in motion.

questions.question: When you see livestock near the roadway, you should:

answers.text: Blow your horn continuously until the animals cross the road.
Turn safely away from these animals.
Slow down or stop.

questions.question: The broken white lines on the pavement mean that:

answers.text: Traffic moves in opposite directions.
No passing is allowed.
Passing is allowed if done safely.

questions.question: If your vehicle starts to hydroplane, you should:

answers.text: Apply the brakes.
Press your gas pedal.
Slow down gradually.

questions.question: A driver who is involved in a significant collision must report it to the DMV within:

answers.text: 20 days.
10 days.
15 days.

questions.question: This sign represents:

answers.text: A school zone.
A pedestrian crosswalk.
A playground.

questions.question: Special 'turnout' areas marked on a two-lane road:

answers.text: Allow vehicles to pass.
Allow vehicles to make left turns.
Allow vehicles to make U-turns.

questions.question: Two sets of solid double yellow lines spaced two or more feet apart indicate:

answers.text: A barrier.
A parking lot.
Two-way traffic.

questions.question: What are the early symptoms of carbon monoxide poisoning?

answers.text: Headache and dizziness.
Sudden fatigue.
Any or all of the above.

questions.question: You can make a left turn on a red light:

answers.text: Only from a two-way street onto another two-way street.
Only from a one-way street onto another one-way street.
Only from a one-way street onto a two-way street.

questions.question: If a California driver is stopped by a police officer for suspected drugged driving, they may have to undergo a ____ test to determine if they are driving under the influence of drugs.

answers.text: Agility.
Cognitive.
Blood.

questions.question: If your parked car rolls away and hits another unattended vehicle, you should:

answers.text: Sound your horn to attract attention.
Remove your car and go on your way.
Report the incident to the police.

questions.question: At 55 mph, under good conditions, a passenger vehicle can stop within:

answers.text: 400 feet.
300 feet.
200 feet.

questions.question: This warning sign represents:

answers.text: The start of a two-way road.
The end of a divided highway.
The start of a divided highway.

questions.question: What is the first thing you should do during an enforcement stop?

answers.text: Stop on the center median.
Turn on your right turn signal.
Stop on the left shoulder.

questions.question: What does this regulatory sign mean?

answers.text: Road ends.
No U-turn.
Left turn.

questions.question: On a two-lane undivided highway, the maximum speed limit for vehicles towing trailers is ______ unless otherwise posted.

answers.text: 60 mph.
55 mph.
65 mph.

questions.question: When you want to enter a freeway, you should:

answers.text: Stop before merging into freeway traffic.
Enter the freeway at or near the speed of freeway traffic.
Stop and yield to the traffic on the freeway.

questions.question: If all vehicles are traveling at 55 mph and have to make a sudden stop, which vehicle will take the longest to come to a stop?

answers.text: A passenger car.
A truck.
A small van.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about lane markings is true?

answers.text: A broken yellow line between opposing lanes of traffic means that you may not cross the line.
A solid white line between lanes of traffic means that you should stay in your lane unless a special situation requires you to change lanes.
A double solid line between opposing lanes of traffic means that vehicles on either side can pass.

questions.question: What should you do if another driver tailgates your vehicle?

answers.text: Increase your speed to get away from the tailgater.
Change lanes to allow the tailgater to pass.
Do not allow the tailgater to pass you.

questions.question: If you plan to turn beyond an intersection, you must:

answers.text: Start signaling when you are in the intersection.
Signal just before making the turn.
Signal before passing through the intersection.

questions.question: What does this sign mean?

answers.text: A flag person is ahead; vehicles must go slow.
A pedestrian crosswalk is ahead; vehicles must yield.
A crew is at work; vehicles must slow down.

questions.question: The wide white line painted across a traffic lane before an intersection is known as a:

answers.text: Limit line.
Crosswalk line.
Merge line.

questions.question: On a highway with three or more lanes going in one direction, vehicles passing others or turning left should use:

answers.text: The left lane.
The middle lane.
The right lane.

questions.question: _________ are the most likely places for car and motorcycle collisions to occur.

answers.text: Expressways.
Intersections.
Roundabouts.

questions.question: When you approach a roundabout, you must enter to the _______ of the central island.

answers.text: Right.
Left.
Center.

questions.question: If a car approaches you with its high-beam headlights on, you must __________ to keep yourself from being temporarily blinded.

answers.text: Look at the center of the road.
Look toward the right edge of the road.
Look toward the left edge of the road.

questions.question: If you are approaching a stop sign, you must:

answers.text: Stop at the broken white limit line.
Stop at the broken yellow limit line.
Stop at the solid white limit line.

questions.question: What should you do if you are overtaking a bicycle and an oncoming vehicle is approaching at the same time?

answers.text: Slow down and let the oncoming vehicle pass first to leave extra room for the bicycle.
Overtake the bicycle first to leave extra room for the oncoming vehicle.
Leave a little room for the oncoming vehicle while overtaking the bicycle.

questions.question: When you turn left from a one-way street onto another one-way street, you should turn into:

answers.text: Any safely open lane.
The far right lane.
The far left lane.

questions.question: At an intersection, you should yield to another vehicle:

answers.text: If the vehicle is to your right and arrived at the same time as you.
If the vehicle is just starting to enter the intersection.
In both of the above situations.

questions.question: Your vehicle breaks down on a freeway. You are not able to move the vehicle off the road completely as the road shoulder is too narrow. What is the best thing to do?

answers.text: Leave the vehicle immediately and wave at drivers to let them know you are blocking the lane.
Exit on the right side of your vehicle and proceed to a safe place.
Stay inside your vehicle with the seat belt on until help arrives.

questions.question: When should you switch on your high-beam headlights?

answers.text: At night when it rains.
When driving in open country at night or on dark city streets.
All night.

questions.question: It is unsafe for you to pass when:

answers.text: The vehicle ahead is traveling slower than the safe speed.
The pavement markings are broken yellow lines.
You are moving through an intersection.

questions.question: A yield sign indicates that a driver must slow down and be prepared to _________ if a vehicle or pedestrian with the right-of-way is approaching from another direction.

answers.text: Make a turn.
Stop.
Increase speed.

questions.question: A center lane between lanes of traffic traveling in opposite directions may be designated for:

answers.text: Left turns only.
Right turns only.
Passing.

questions.question: What does this sign mean?

answers.text: A place reserved for persons with disabilities.
Wheelchair availability.
A hospital ahead.

questions.question: Which of these signs indicates a hospital ahead?

answers.text: A.
D.
C.
B.

questions.question: When you park and leave your vehicle on a highway or street, you should NOT:

answers.text: Stop the engine.
Lower the windows.
Set the parking brake.

questions.question: Before backing up your vehicle, you should look to the front, sides, and rear, and continue to look _________ while backing.

answers.text: To the rear.
In the side mirrors.
To the front.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about passing other vehicles is true?

answers.text: Always signal before passing.
Do not pull out to pass unless you know you will have enough space to pull back into your lane.
Both of the above are true.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about using headlights is FALSE?

answers.text: Low beams are used in city driving and driving in traffic on roadways.
High beams are used when traveling behind other vehicles.
Low beams are used when traveling in fog, rain, or snow.

questions.question: Lanes of traffic going in opposite directions are divided by:

answers.text: White lines.
Black lines.
Yellow lines.

questions.question: What does this sign mean?

answers.text: Merge left.
Go straight.
Turn left or go straight.

questions.question: What does this sign indicate?

answers.text: Look straight while driving.
There is a one-way street ahead.
You can only go straight.

questions.question: All regulatory devices on the road tell you:

answers.text: About hazardous conditions or the possibility of hazardous conditions.
How to find your way safely or provide information to make your trip more comfortable.
To stop, proceed in a certain direction, or limit your speed.

questions.question: Following too closely behind another vehicle is called:

answers.text: Defensive driving.
Aggressive driving.
Tailgating.

questions.question: High-Occupancy Vehicle (HOV) lanes are reserved for:

answers.text: Car pools and vehicles with more than one person.
Tractor-trailers with less than three persons.
Farm machinery vehicles and trucks.

questions.question: Large electronic flashing arrow panels may be used in work zones day and night to:

answers.text: Guide drivers into certain traffic lanes.
Divert drivers into work zones.
Guide drivers into certain parking zones.

questions.question: What is the first rule of a safe and legal turn?

answers.text: Increase speed.
Reduce speed.
Move into the proper lane well before the turn.

questions.question: You are driving on the freeway and notice another driver using a handheld cell phone. What is the best thing to do?

answers.text: Increase your following distance.
Alert the police immediately.
Honk your horn and wave to the driver to get off the phone.

questions.question: When parking on a public road, you must park parallel to and within ____ inches of the curb or edge of the roadway.
If a tire suddenly goes flat while you're driving, you should:

answers.text: Hold the steering wheel tightly and keep the vehicle straight.
Move to the left side of the road.
Increase your speed.

questions.question: When turning left from a multi-lane one-way road onto another one-way road, start your turn from:

answers.text: The far left lane.
Any lane.
The far right lane.

questions.question: You must use your high-beam headlights in all of the following situations, except:

answers.text: On unfamiliar roads.
In fog, snow, or heavy rain.
In construction areas.

questions.question: In California, the speed limit for a blind intersection is:

answers.text: 25 mph.
20 mph.
15 mph.

questions.question: When you turn off a high-speed, two-lane roadway, _______ if you have traffic following you.

answers.text: Try not to slow down your vehicle too quickly.
Try to slow down your vehicle quickly.
Try to increase the speed of your vehicle.

questions.question: Before reaching the crest of a hill or entering a curve, you must _________, and watch for oncoming vehicles.

answers.text: Speed up, turn on the headlights.
Slow down, move to the right side of the road.
Slow down, move to the left side of the road.

questions.question: Blind pedestrians may carry _________ canes or use guide dogs.

answers.text: Red.
Black.
White.

questions.question: Flashing yellow lights on a school bus require other drivers to:

answers.text: Slow their vehicles and pass with caution.
Slow their vehicles and prepare to stop.
Pass quickly.

questions.question: Do not use your horn:

answers.text: When you want the driver in front of you to move out of the way.
To honk at a blind person.
In any of the above situations.

questions.question: If you approach an intersection with a steady yellow light, you must:

answers.text: Stop and wait for the red light.
Stop, look for pedestrians, and proceed with caution.
Slow down and proceed with caution, if you cannot stop safely.

questions.question: This sign warns that:

answers.text: The road is slippery when wet; drivers must go slow.
A winding road is ahead; drivers should follow the directions.
There is a gravel road with sharp curves ahead; drivers must proceed carefully.

questions.question: What is the correct hand signal for indicating a right turn?

answers.text: Hand and arm extended outward.
Hand and arm extended upward.
Hand and arm extended downward.

questions.question: You may pass a stopped light-rail vehicle on the left side:

answers.text: If the tracks are so close to the right side that you cannot pass on the right.
On one-way streets.
In both of the above situations.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about passing a vehicle is FALSE?

answers.text: Do not follow another vehicle that is passing a car in front of you.
Do not pass more than one vehicle at a time.
You can exceed the speed limit to pass quickly.

questions.question: You are driving slowly on a two-lane road. If there are at least ____ vehicles behind you that are unable to pass you, you must pull over and allow them to pass.
The octagonal shape in the figure is:

answers.text: A Do Not Enter sign.
A Stop sign.
A Yield sign.

questions.question: _________ occurs on wet roads when your front tires start to ride on water instead of on the road.

answers.text: Hydroplaning.
Tailgating.
Weaving.

questions.question: With any turning vehicle, the rear wheels follow a _________ than the front wheels.

answers.text: Shorter path.
Slower path.
Longer path.

questions.question: If you are parallel parked on the right-hand side of the street, you should _________ before pulling out into traffic.

answers.text: Signal a right turn and look over your right shoulder.
Signal a left turn and look over your left shoulder.
Signal a left turn and look over your right shoulder.

questions.question: If a pedestrian is in a marked or unmarked crosswalk, you must:

answers.text: Reduce your speed and proceed with caution.
Increase your speed and cross the crosswalk quickly.
Yield to the pedestrian.

questions.question: On two-lane highways, you are allowed to pass:

answers.text: While crossing or within 100 feet of a railroad crossing.
When there is a broken yellow line on your side of the center dividing line.
When you are approaching the top of a hill or are on a curve, and there is no clear view ahead.

questions.question: Car drivers should NEVER:

answers.text: Give a motorcycle the full lane.
Pass a motorcycle in the same lane.
Move to one side of your lane to give motorcyclists more room to pass.

questions.question: On one-way roads, yellow lines are used as:

answers.text: Right-edge lines.
Left-edge lines.
Center lines.

questions.question: A triangular orange sign on the rear of a vehicle indicates that:

answers.text: The vehicle can travel faster than 25 mph.
The vehicle cannot travel faster than 25 mph.
The vehicle cannot travel faster than 45 mph.

questions.question: On two-lane roads where traffic moves in opposite directions, you may pass on the left only when:

answers.text: A solid yellow line is in your lane.
A broken yellow line is in your lane.
A double solid yellow line is in the center.

questions.question: When approaching an intersection to make a right turn, you must stay _________ and make the turn close to the right curb.

answers.text: As close to the left as possible.
As close to the right as possible.
On the shoulder.

questions.question: The primary traveling aids for a blind person include:

answers.text: A white cane and a wheelchair.
A white cane and a trained guide dog.
A red cane and a trained guide dog.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about the right-of-way is FALSE?

answers.text: At a T-intersection without signs or signals, a vehicle on the through road must yield to vehicles on the terminating road.
Vehicles entering or crossing a roadway from a private driveway must yield to all approaching vehicles.
Vehicles must yield to pedestrians in unmarked crosswalks.

questions.question: If a driver extends his or her left arm out horizontally, it indicates that the driver is going to:

answers.text: Make a right turn.
Stop the vehicle.
Make a left turn.

questions.question: If temperatures are near freezing, which freezes first?

answers.text: Bridges.
Both roads and bridges at the same time.
Roads.

questions.question: When you see an emergency vehicle with its lights flashing on the wrong side of the road, giving instructions through the loudspeaker, you should:

answers.text: Stop immediately on the spot.
Obey the instructions.
Proceed slowly.

questions.question: An __________ is the connection of a freeway to a road or another freeway by a series of ramps.

answers.text: Interchange.
Acceleration lane.
Exit ramp.

questions.question: What does this flashing arrow panel mean?

answers.text: The roadway ahead is open to traffic.
The roadway ahead curves to the left.
Part of the roadway ahead is closed.

questions.question: When waiting to make a left turn at an intersection:

answers.text: Shift gears.
Keep your wheels straight.
Keep your wheels turned toward the left.

questions.question: If you see two solid yellow lines on a roadway, it means that:

answers.text: Passing is permitted at any time.
No passing is permitted.
Passing is permitted during the day.

questions.question: What does this road sign indicate?

answers.text: Trucks turning ahead.
A slippery road ahead.
A steep downgrade ahead.

questions.question: When turning right into a two-way street, start in the right-hand lane and enter into:

answers.text: The far left lane.
The lane nearest to the right edge of the road.
Any available lane.

questions.question: This hand signal indicates that:

answers.text: The driver is slowing or stopping.
The driver is making a right turn.
The driver is making a left turn.

questions.question: Vehicles approaching a roundabout must:

answers.text: Yield to the traffic in the roundabout.
Come to a complete stop and wait for traffic in the roundabout to clear.
Enter the roundabout to the left of the central island.

questions.question: On a two-way roadway with a center lane, drivers from either direction can _________ from the center lane.

answers.text: Park.
Make left turns and U-turns.
Make right turns.

questions.question: While driving, when you see a triangular road sign, you must:

answers.text: Come to a complete stop.
Increase your speed.
Reduce your speed and yield.

questions.question: At an intersection, a steady yellow arrow signal pointing left indicates to the driver that:

answers.text: Oncoming traffic is stopped and he or she may turn left.
The signal is about to change to a green or red light or a red arrow.
He or she must increase speed.

questions.question: Which of the following are used as left-edge lines on divided highways?

answers.text: Single solid yellow lines.
Double solid white lines.
Single solid white lines.

questions.question: You may not cross a double solid yellow line on your left to:

answers.text: Turn left into a driveway.
Make a U-turn.
Pass another vehicle.

questions.question: Flag persons are often located on highways and in work zones:

answers.text: To slow vehicles to a lower speed limit posted ahead.
To stop, slow, or guide the traffic in work zones.
To report accidents to the police department and insurance companies.

questions.question: Which of the following right-of-way rules is FALSE?

answers.text: At an intersection where there is no stop sign, yield sign, or traffic signal, drivers must yield to vehicles coming from the left.
You must obey signals given by a law enforcement officer, even if the officer's signals contradict the traffic signals.
At all times, drivers must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians in a marked or unmarked crosswalk.

questions.question: A _________ indicates the outer edge of a roadway, and it may be crossed only by traffic moving to or from the shoulder.

answers.text: Solid white line.
Solid yellow line.
Broken white line.

questions.question: On one-way roads, yellow lines are used as:

answers.text: Right-edge lines.
Left-edge lines.
Center lines.

questions.question: A triangular orange sign on the rear of a vehicle indicates that:

answers.text: The vehicle can travel faster than 25 mph.
The vehicle cannot travel faster than 25 mph.
The vehicle cannot travel faster than 45 mph.

questions.question: On two-lane roads where traffic moves in opposite directions, you may pass on the left only when:

answers.text: A solid yellow line is in your lane.
A broken yellow line is in your lane.
A double solid yellow line is in the center.
